request.description:
# Quantum Readiness Check API

This guide provides instructions on how to use the Quantum Readiness Check API. This API allows you to check if a given URL is using quantum-safe encryption.

## Requirements

To send requests to the API, you'll need the following:

- A RapidAPI account. You can sign up [here](https://rapidapi.com/).
- Your RapidAPI key. You can find this on your RapidAPI dashboard.
    

## Usage

To use the API, send a POST request to the following endpoint:

`https://quantum-readiness-check1.p.rapidapi.com/Chat/CheckQuantum`

The body of the request should contain a single string, which is the URL you want to check.

Here's an example using cURL:

``` bash
curl --request POST \
  --url https://quantum-readiness-check1.p.rapidapi.com/Chat/CheckQuantum \
  --header 'X-RapidAPI-Host: quantum-readiness-check1.p.rapidapi.com' \
  --header 'X-RapidAPI-Key: <YOUR_RAPIDAPI_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '"<URL_TO_CHECK>"'

```

Replace `<YOUR_RAPIDAPI_KEY>` with your RapidAPI key, and replace `<URL_TO_CHECK>` with the URL you want to check.

Please note that the URL should be enclosed in double quotes, and the entire JSON string should be enclosed in single quotes.

## Response

The API will return a JSON response indicating whether the URL is using quantum-safe encryption.

Here's an example of a successful response:

``` json
{
  "message": " SERVICE : CheckQuantum : Using quantum safe handshake : x25519_kyber512",
  "success": true,
  "data": null
}

```

In this response, the `"message"` field provides information about the encryption used by the URL, and the `"success"` field indicates whether the check was successful.

## Support

contact [support@mahadeva.co.uk](mailto:support@mahadeva.co.uk)
